case_vignette: A 67-year-old male presents to his primary care physician complaining of increased fatigue over the last year. He also says that his friends say he appears to be more pale. His past medical history is significant for 10 years of arthritis. Physical exam reveals spoon shaped nails as well as conjunctival pallor. Based on clinical suspicion RBC tests are ordered showing an mean corpuscular volume (MCV) of 75 fl (normal 80-100 fl) and a peripheral blood smear is obtained and found to be normal. Iron studies shows a serum iron of 30 micromolar (normal range 50-170) and a serum ferritin of 300 micrograms/liter (normal range 15-200).
question: What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Hematology and Oncology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling increasingly tired over the last year, and my friends have mentioned that I look more pale than usual.
How old are you?
I am 67 years old.
Have you experienced any unexplained weight loss recently?
No, I haven't experienced any unexplained weight loss.
Do you have any personal or family history of blood disorders or cancers?
My past medical history is significant for 10 years of arthritis, but there's no mention of blood disorders or cancers.
Are you currently on any medications for arthritis or any other conditions?
The vignette does not provide information about my current medications.
Have you noticed any swollen lymph nodes in your neck, armpits, or groin?
No, I haven't noticed any swollen lymph nodes.
**Final Diagnosis:** Anemia of Chronic Disease
